intro: Loasa remyi, commonly known as the roughleaf loasa, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers in terminal clusters during the spring. Loasa remyi is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant plant in its native range.
